conclusion: The problem involves analyzing the U-I graphs of a power source and a light bulb.
The graph shows a straight line (a) representing the power source and a curved line (b) representing the light bulb.
The straight line (a) has a slope indicating the internal resistance of the power source.
The y-intercept of the straight line (a) gives the electromotive force (emf) of the power source.
The intersection of the two lines occurs at \\( U = 2 \, \text{V} \\) and \\( I = 2 \, \text{A} \\).
The output power of the power source is calculated as \\( P_{\text{out}} = U \times I = 2 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 4 \, \text{W} \\).
The total power of the power source is calculated as \\( P_{\text{total}} = E \times I = 3 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 6 \, \text{W} \\).
The internal resistance of the power source is confirmed to be \\( 0.5 \, \Omega \\).
The output power of the power source is \\( 4 \, \text{W} \\) and the total power of the power source is \\( 6 \, \text{W} \\).
